forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of mostly cloudy skies envelops the city, with a glimpse of clarity teasing from the west. The gentle yet brisk west-southwest winds whisper through the air, a reminder of the coastal influence that often defines this unique urban landscape. While the temperature hovers around a mild 54 degrees, it’s advisable to layer up; a light sweater or jacket will provide comfort against the cool breezes, particularly if you venture out along the waterfront where the chill can bite more keenly.

Looking ahead to Sunday, the sun is poised to emerge, unfurling its warmth over the city. With a forecast high near 63, expect the skies to gradually brighten, perfect for a leisurely afternoon stroll or perhaps a quiet coffee at a favorite local café. As the temperatures ease into the early 60s, the day promises a pleasant transition, while gusts may still ripple through the streets at 13 to 21 mph. Engage in the simple joys of daily life—perhaps grab a book and find a sunny spot in one of the city’s parks, or enjoy the gradually rising warmth at an outdoor market. The marine layer will linger but will offer a soft, misty embrace, providing that quintessential San Francisco charm as you explore, reflecting the city’s constant dialogue with the sea.
